class_notes: This is a debate class whose goal is to help students discover and better articulate their own moral views with respect to health care. This requires first familiarizing ourselves with the major classical approaches to this field (Utilitarianism, Kantianism, Natural Law, etc.) and then evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each of these approaches for a variety of health care situations. Some of the topics covered include patient rights, research ethics, reproductive rights, abortion eugenics, euthanasia, organ transplantation, and inequalities in our health care system.
course_description: The goal of this course is to better understand and articulate our ethical views on the American healthcare system. The class includes an overview of classic ethical theories and principles, but focuses on the application of these theories and principles to a variety of healthcare contexts.
schedule_location: TTh 4pm-5:15pm in Math & Science Center - N306
